attributes.action: End unjustifiable price increases based on RPI PLUS a random percentage.
attributes.additional_details:
Price increases should be justifiable by increases in costs and overheads – this process, which I believe can be accurately described as “PYRAMID PRICING” cannot be! 

In a worked example based on £10 plus RP of just 2%, over the course of the last 23 years, plus Virgin & others 3.9% came to £74 whilst inflation would have been just £18.00. This is more than FOUR times the inflation in the same period.
attributes.background: Make it illegal for firms to increase their prices on the basis of an increase in line with the Retail Price Index PLUS a random percentage chosen by them.  This can produce an increase many times normal inflation and contribute hugely to national inflation.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about the price of individual products and services are a matter for suppliers and retailers, not the UK Government or Parliament.
